TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi NavigationWindow extends System.Windows.Window implements class System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext

Docs.summary: Represents a window that supports content navigation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> derives from <xref:System.Windows.Window> and extends it with the ability to navigate to and display content.
Content can be any [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winfx](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winfx-md.md)] object or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_html](~/includes/tlasharptla-html-md.md)] file. In general, however, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Page> object is the preferred way to package content for navigation.
Content can be navigated to by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Source%2A> property with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the desired content. Additionally, content can be navigated to by using one of the following overloads of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> method:
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Uri%29>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Uri%2CSystem.Object%29>
When content is navigated to by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)], <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> will return an object that contains the content.
> [!NOTE] > Navigation by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] also supports navigation to a content fragment. See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.FragmentNavigation>.
Alternatively, content can be navigated to by using one of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> method overloads that accepts an object:
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Object%29>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%28System.Object%2CSystem.Object%29>
The lifetime of a navigation can be tracked through the following events:
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigating>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigated>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationProgress>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationFailed>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationStopped>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.LoadCompleted>
- <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.FragmentNavigation>.
Not all events are raised each time that a navigation occurs; the set of events that are raised is determined by the type of navigation that occurs (content or content fragment) and how the navigation completes (canceled, stopped, or failed).
The following figure illustrates the sequence in which these events will fire:
![Page navigation flow chart](~/add/media/navigationoverviewfigure11.png "Page navigation flow chart")
During or after a navigation, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> provides information about the content that is being navigated to, including the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the content being navigated to (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Source%2A>), the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the current content (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CurrentSource%2A>), and an object that contains the content that was navigated to (<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A>).
When content is navigated to, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> records the navigation as an entry in navigation history. An entry is added to back navigation history when either a new navigation occurs, by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> method, or by navigating to an entry in forward navigation history, by calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.GoForward%2A>. An entry is added to forward navigation history by navigating to an entry in back navigation history, by calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.GoBack%2A>. <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CanGoBack%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.CanGoForward%2A> report whether there are entries in back and forward navigation history, respectively.
The first time that one piece of content is navigated to from another piece of content, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> automatically displays a navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] that allows users to navigate back and forwards through navigation history. You can configure when the navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] is shown by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.ShowsNavigationUI%2A> property.
The most recent entry in back navigation history can be removed by calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.RemoveBackEntry%2A>.
<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> does not store an instance of a content object in navigation history. Instead, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> creates a new instance of the content object each time it is navigated to by using navigation history. This behavior is designed to avoid excessive memory consumption when large numbers and large pieces of content are being navigated to. Consequently, the state of the content is not remembered from one navigation to the next. However, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wpf](~/includes/tla2sharptla-wpf-md.md)] provides several techniques by which you can store a piece of state for a piece of content in navigation history.
Using <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.AddBackEntry%2A>, you can also remember multiple sets of state for a single page instance.
<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> is one of two navigators in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wpf](~/includes/tla2sharptla-wpf-md.md)], the other being <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame>. Essentially, navigator is a class supports navigation and navigation history. Visually, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xbapsharpplural-md.md)] use [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)] as a navigator, to provide an integrated user experience. However, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xbapsharpplural-md.md)] actually use <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> as the navigator; the <xref:System.Windows.Application.MainWindow%2A> property of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xbap-md.md)] running in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)] will return a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, and the navigation history that is managed by the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> is integrated with the navigation history that is managed by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)].
**Content Model:** <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> can contain content such as text, images, or panels. Also, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> is a root element and, consequently, cannot be part of another element's content. For more information about the content model for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, see [WPF Content Model](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/wpf-content-model.md).
## Customizing the NavigationWindow Control To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property. You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance. For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md). To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, see [NavigationWindow Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/navigationwindow-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style. If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application. The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running. For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> control's default template and is set by using a . You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>.

Docs.summary: Gets the that is used by this to provide navigation services to its content.
Docs.value: The navigation service used by this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> uses a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService> to provide navigation services to content that is hosted by <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>. The <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationService%2A> property is useful for code in a custom <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> to get a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService>, to handle navigation events, for example.
Content that is hosted by a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Page>, should use the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.GetNavigationService%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Page.NavigationService%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get a reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService>.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the method is called, or when a new navigation is requested while a current navigation is in progress.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.NavigationStopped?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a isolates external [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] content within a partial trust security sandbox (with default Internet zone permission set).
Docs.value: if content is isolated within a partial trust security sandbox; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks External content is [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] content that is not included with an application as either a resource file or a content file (for more information, see [WPF Application Resource, Content, and Data Files](~/docs/framework/wpf/app-development/wpf-application-resource-content-and-data-files.md)). When is true, and the content of the is an external [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] file, the content is loaded into a partial trust security sandbox that is limited to the default Internet zone permission set. Additionally, the external content is loaded into a separate process. Consequently, the external content becomes isolated and does not have access to application-scope resources, such as resource dictionaries (for more information, see ). > [!NOTE] > contains external content only when the property is set to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] for an external [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] file. content that is provided using the property is considered internal content and, subsequently, is not isolated. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.exception: is set when an application is executing in partial trust.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty SandboxExternalContentProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool ShouldSerializeContent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the property should be persisted.
Docs.returns: if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically call this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a shows its navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)].
Docs.value: if the navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] is displayed; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To aid back and forward navigation, automatically displays a navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] Navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] is displayed whether or not navigation has occurred. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ShowsNavigationUIProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the current content, or the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of new content that is currently being navigated to.
Docs.value: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] for the current content, or the content that is currently being navigated to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See . > [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri#initcap#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-urisharpinitcapsharpplural-md.md)] can be either relative or absolute. For more information, see [Pack URIs in WPF](~/docs/framework/wpf/app-development/pack-uris-in-wpf.md). ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|| ## Examples The following example shows how to navigate to a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] by setting the property. [!code-csharp[HOWTONavigationSnippets#NavigateToPageSrcCODE](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/HOWTONavigationSnippets/CSharp/MainWindow.xaml.cs#navigatetopagesrccode)] [!code-vb[HOWTONavigationSnippets#NavigateToPageSrcCODE](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/HOWTONavigationSnippets/visualbasic/mainwindow.xaml.vb#navigatetopagesrccode)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void StopLoading() cil managed

Docs.summary: Stops further downloading of content for the current navigation request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.StopLoading%2A> stops the download of the requested content, and causes the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationStopped> event to be raised.
See <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.StopLoading%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
## Examples The following example shows how to call the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.StopLoading%2A> method to stop navigation to content before it has finished being downloaded.
[!code-csharp[HOWTONavigationSnippets#NavigateStopLoadingCODE](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/HOWTONavigationSnippets/CSharp/MainWindow.xaml.cs#navigatestoploadingcode)] [!code-vb[HOWTONavigationSnippets#NavigateStopLoadingCODE](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/HOWTONavigationSnippets/visualbasic/mainwindow.xaml.vb#navigatestoploadingcode)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the base uniform resource identifier (URI) of the current context.
Docs.value: The base URI of the current context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext> interface.
